item.title: HELP PL()X - Problems with portforwarding
item.dc:creator: @ramboss ramboss
item.description:
@ramboss wrote:

Recently ive been trying to release my version of the new “PkPlanet” which im sure some of you will be familiar of…
I’ve tried many possible portforwarding methods, e.g. uTorrent, Router, Hamachi. and yet none of them are getting me through to making my server online to the public. So im assuming its a problem with the way i’ve set up the IP codes within the server.

This is what i’ve got:

Source: -client.Java -

public int GetWorld(int PlayerID) {
String Server = PlayerHandler.players[PlayerID].playerServer;

	if (Server.equals("chaoticpkers.no-ip.biz") || Server.equals("localhost")) {
		return 1;
	} else if (Server.equals("192.168.2.8")) {
		return 2;
	} else {
		println_debug("Invalid Server: " + Server);
		return 1;

Client: GUI.Java -

System.out.println(“Connecting”);
//launchURL(“chaoticpkers.no-ip.biz”);
Serverip = “192.168.2.8”;
sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(Serverip));

They are the only changes I have made coding wise (with IP address/config) so please tell me what im doing wrong…

Pk Planet source + client by Bashar:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Thanks

Read full topic
